intro: Desmopsis colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian desmopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
